column4: i want to try ubuntu but i don't know which version 32bits or 64bits and kubuntu or xubuntu??? and what is the best thing to do to install it alonside windows? do i have to create a new partition first?
if you just want to try the OS, you can boot a liveCD or USB and use the OS there, in RAM
The installer can resize your NTFS, If you use Win7 it can resize it's own NTFS partition and leave free space too
either way ensure your backups are up to date in case of catastrophe
